reviews.text: Scorched Cream crab soup. Waited 20 minutes for it. Think they made it on the fly. Steak was cooked perfectly but was so over salted , it was hard to eat. I love Salt ..this was ridiculous. The offered to make a new one but I was starving not have eaten since breakfast and then not having the soup. They took of 20% of the Price of the beef ...a gesture... Dessert Baked Alaska  Meringue was sickly sweet but had a beautiful silky texture.T he Mint was overpowering . Service was very good except one waiter went to clear my plate  ,Crossed over way to close to me , ruff table side manners.  A Surf n turf was served uncracked lobster w no tools to do so... ridiculous! Don't bother waisting your time , money .

This restaurant must be straggling to survive because I‚Äôve never seen bread listed on any menu for $12! French fries for $15! And creamed spinach for $16! Food was‚Ä¶. Food. Nothing to write home about.

What an amazing meal. We made a last minute decision to swing by here for dinner on Halloween and maybe check out the Sunken Harbor Club upstairs. Our original plan was drinks upstairs followed by dinner downstairs, but that quickly flipped around when we learned that there was a 90 minute wait for the nautical speakeasy. I'm glad our plans changed though as we were already fairly hungry, and after a few drinks upstairs, we wouldn't have savored every bite the way we did by eating first. About once or twice a year, we splurge and try caviar at various restaurants. This was among our absolute favorites. The blinis were soft, tasty and perfect sized. The creme that was served with it made a nice addition, but ultimately it all let the caviar be the star of the show (and it was). If you've never tried caviar before, this is the place to begin your journey. From there we got the she-crab soup and the roasted pumpkin soup along with the house rolls (these rolls are enough reason to come here - holy cow they were so good). Both soups hit the spot and it was tough to pick a favorite. Finally for our entree, we split the Beef Wellington for Two. I might rate this dish a hair below amazing, but still very good. The presentation was beautiful, the steak was cooked perfectly and the sauce hit all the right notes, but I feel like due to its size, the ratio of mushroom and pastry was miniscule compared to the steak. Again, still a very good meal, but might opt to try something else next time we dine here, and trust me, there will be a next time. The staff were outstanding. The crew that greeted us were fantastic in helping us get a table as well as help us organize with the hostess from upstairs to plan an amazing evening. Our server was wonderful and perfectly attentive. She even complemented us on our food choices, remarking that many of these are her favorites. The building itself is absolutely stunning. I had read about how both the interior and exterior are landmarked and I read a brief history of the restaurant on their website. It truly was a wonderful evening and I look forward to our next time dining here.
Great oyster happy hours, helpful service, and good vibes

We had a great time.  The atmosphere is awesome and the service is excellent.  The food is what it is: steakhouse staples with classic flavors.  Everything was good but nothing truly blew us away.  Got the Ny strip, crab soup, rolls, dry aged pork chop, and hen of the woods mushrooms.

The baked alaska was incredible and the best part of the meal.

I think steakhouses in general are very overpriced and not worth the time.

Our favorite restaurant in Brooklyn! Great rotation of oysters during their happy hour. We love the friendly bartenders too especially Lucky, Rachel, Ben, and Kern! Aside from the oysters, our other favs include the hen of the woods mushrooms, she-crab soup, parker house rolls, and the shared porterhouse. If you're going for dinner, put your name in for the Sunken Harbor Club for a nightcap upstairs after your meal.

The Best Post-Breakup Meal a Girl Could Ask For
Five out of Five Stars (and I needed every single one of them)
Let me start by saying: my emotional state when I walked into Gage & Tollner this past Sunday was... dramatic. I had just ended a "Summer Fling" (which, let's be honest, felt like a Shakespearean tragedy at the time, but now I mostly just want to laugh at myself). I needed an emotional outlet, and what better outlet than a full-on, glorious, celebratory seafood dinner?
Well guess what ....they delivered a therapy session on a plate!
First, the food: The Crab Soup was comforting, and exactly what a heartbroken (and now slightly embarrassed) woman needed. The Oysters Rockefeller tasted like a buttery, decadent hug. Seriously, I felt better with every slurp. And the Roasted Cauliflower? Perfection. Just the right amount of char to give it a great smokey kick.To wash it all down, I had a much-needed glass of Trousse-Chemise, Shea Vineyard. Let's just say, the vineyard was doing the Lord's work that night. But the real star of the show was the service. My spirits were lifted, not just by the food and the wine, but by the manager. He was incredibly friendly and I swear, he looked exactly like Snoop Dogg's more refined, hospitality-focused cousin. He noticed I was having a moment and told me I needed to smile. It sounds simple, but that little compliment completely brightened my day. It was the universe's way of saying, "Honey, that summer guy was a footnote; now eat this delicious oyster and move on. So, to Gage & Tollner: Thank you for the incredible food, the good vibes, and for employing a manager who is a dead ringer for a hip-hop icon and an excellent compliment-giver. You turned my personal melodrama into a hilarious, delicious Sunday night story. You deserve every star!

Top-Tier Service and Ambiance

First and foremost, the service is truly world-class. From the moment we walked in, the entire team exuded genuine warmth, respect, and professionalism. The smiles and the overall ambiance created a welcoming environment that is desperately needed in NYC and should be copied by other establishments.

A special shout-out must go to our server, Lexy, who was utterly amazing and accommodating throughout the evening‚Äîwe adored her! Manager Corbin was also exceptionally warm and went above and beyond to ensure our party had a perfect experience. He had the best smile and attentiveness.

The Food: A Culinary Journey

The care and skill in the kitchen match the front-of-house excellence.

Appetizers: We started our culinary journey with several winners. The Parker Rolls were divine‚Äîperfectly warm and buttery. The mushrooms were earthy and impeccably seasoned, and the side salad was properly dressed and served incredibly fresh, offering a delightful crunch with every bite.

Entrees: For the main course, the fried chicken was a standout: perfectly crispy and seasoned, served alongside whipped potatoes that were amazing. We loved the balance of textures and flavors in every dish we ordered.

Desserts: The meal culminated in a 10 out of 10 finale. The rich and decadent chocolate layered cake was exceptional. Likewise, the sorbets, particularly the lemon and vanilla flavors, were bright, refreshing, and beyond perfect.

Conclusion

This establishment delivers an outstanding combination of world-class service and exceptional, thoughtful cuisine. It unequivocally deserves a ten out of ten. We absolutely cannot wait to return for another unforgettable meal.
The restaurant interior was beautiful, the steaks were mediocre, baked alaska was delicious and arguably the best in the city, and the service was horrendous
One of my absolute favorite restaurants to go too
Zaista predivno iskustvo u ovom restoranu
Delicious steak, lovely staff.
Incredible food in a gorgeous restaurant. We had brunch and loved it. Can't wait for Sunken Harbour club tonight.
Outstanding service and has become one of my favorite places for steak in the NYC area! Will definitely be back!

A bit overpriced but it‚Äôs such a special experience to dine at an establishment with so much history!! Finally tried the baked alaska, it was so indulgent üò≥Our waiter was super nice too! I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll come back in the future but it‚Äôs worth visiting once at least for sure
great service and overall the steak was good but it felt overpriced for the quality
Gem! I was thoroughly impressed by this place. Just wish I knew about the speakeasy!

We chose this local restaurant to celebrate my son‚Äôs birthday because steak is his favorite, and we were hoping for something special. Unfortunately, I left regretting the choice.

The interior and decor were lovely‚Äîelegant and inviting‚Äîbut the service felt robotic. There was no warm welcome or personable interaction. When you go to a nicer restaurant for a special occasion, you expect a more thoughtful and engaging experience. This felt no different from a run-of-the-mill spot.

We ordered the ‚Äústeak for three,‚Äù but the portion felt more like it was for two. On top of that, we asked for medium, but what we got was definitely medium-well. The food wasn‚Äôt bad, but nothing stood out, and it certainly didn‚Äôt feel worth the price.

All in all, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place for a special occasion. It might be okay for a regular dinner, but if you‚Äôre celebrating something meaningful, I‚Äôd suggest looking elsewhere.
Wonderful grass fed steaks.  Atmosphere is very loud.  Great food and service.
Go for happy hour and sit at the bar.

Beautiful restaurant in an historic building.  Went for the happy hour on the weekend and had drinks and raw bar.  Both were great but the clams were a little small.  Still worth it though.  Wait staff was friendly and efficient.

Called the night before and they were able to accommodate a party of 7 at 8 pm on a Wednesday, My guests were super impressed and really enjoyed the food, ambience and service. Really reasonable prices for substantial delicious steak and the Parker house rolls and baked Alaska was such a treat. Highly recommend!
Cool place. Good food and nice people.
Stunning restaurant, super old school. I went to brunch with friends. And had their version of broccoli Benny.
–ºgood!!!

All I can say is that I've visited NYC back in 2023 came across this place and it made me never wanted to leave the big apple ..the overall experience is just beyond magnificent.the prices are are well worth the portion there dessert menu has everything you could want to satisfy that sweet tooth yet my personal favorite are there house made rolls..if your looking for heaven in the middle of Brooklyn Gauge and Tolner is where it's at ! ..it's 2025 I just couldn't stand the thought not to be near this place so i relocated to Brooklyn one month after eating here ..I really do love this place!
Old school, classic establishment with amazing martinis and food. Stopped by for a snack and a cocktail at the bar. Super cool vibe, service was on point.
The food was amazing. The service was very nice and the old atmosphere was very homey and beautiful.
Incre√≠ble bar de 1875 !!! Atendido excelentemente. Tragos buen√≠simos üëè üëå
√ìtima carne, atendimento e lugar bem tradicional
Top notch food and service !
Teddy, our server, was wonderful. A magical evening.
A delight. A wonder. A bonanza. Gem in the dark. Glower in the wasteland. The kingpin of Brooklyn. Thank you for standing tall amidst the years. May your treats stay tremendous, forevermore. Fin

The steak portions were a bit small, so we ordered an extra serving. However, the meat was flavorful and well-prepared. Our server was cheerful and had a great sense of humor, which made us overlook the portion size. Overall, it was a lovely evening  thanks üéâ
Totally recommend the fried chicken.

Our server was great and the atmosphere remains very charming. That said, some of the food missed the mark this time. The chicken liver was unexpectedly acidic, which overpowered the dish, and the fried chicken; especially the small accompanying pieces (hush puppies) lacked flavor and didn‚Äôt quite work for us. The Caesar salad and bread were great as always, but overall the food quality felt a step down from past visits‚Ä¶ :(
Lovely old fashioned restaurant, would definitely go again
A lovely evening, with great steak and cocktails.
Great steaks and cocktails,make sure to check out Sunken Harbor Club upstairs!

Amazing.This place was so packed when we arrived ( with no reservation) however the hospitality was great . Two people were  just getting up at the bar, grabbed the seats and a fabulous adventure began. We were lucky and did I mention our bartender's name was LUCKY? Lucky made the most amazing drinks...the very best cucumber martini ever and guided us through the delicious menu. Can't say enough about the food as we tasted many things and watching Lucky make drinks was 100 % all the way. Make sure if in, around or passing through Brooklyn you try this amazing restaurant.
Roasted butter hash browns are an experience. Get the steak medium rare.
Es fant√°stico visitar √©se lugar que  me gustar√≠a visitar d√© nuevo üôÇüôÇ

A very neat place. Very old, ~1900, and full of character.

We only tackled the lunch menu, so difficult to anticipate the dinner menu.

Our food was good the Biscuit and gravy especially.

Dessert choice is a bit limited though.

The bar looked very enticing, and would be a great place to spend a mellow evening at.

Overall a very excellent place to try if you are in the neighborhood.
A classic, it's like going back in time

We had an excellent experience: great food, a historic and memorable interior of the 1920s and the service was flawless too: our waitress Vicky was extremely friendly and her style also matched that of the place.

Gage & Tollner is a true gem and a perfect spot for a special date night. This historic Brooklyn steakhouse has been around since 1879, and it‚Äôs easy to see why it‚Äôs stood the test of time. The food is outstanding‚Äîclassic surf & turf done right, with incredibly high-quality ingredients. I especially appreciate that their steaks are grass-fed, dry-aged, and many ingredients are sourced from local farms, which really shows in the flavor.

The service is warm and attentive, and the old-school atmosphere adds to the charm. It‚Äôs definitely on the pricier side, but well worth it for the quality and experience. My only minor complaint is that the tables are a little too close together, which can make it feel a bit tight. That said, we‚Äôll absolutely be back‚Äîthis place is a Brooklyn classic for a reason.
Great food and drinks, very friendly and helpful service, killer atmosphere. We had a very enjoyable night and will be back!
Love this place. Food is elevated, high quality, and the service is impeccable.
Great experience for a work outing.

Fabulous old school spot- hidden gem. Service is fantastic. I frequent regularly during happy hour and typically end up staying for dinner. Great cocktails, delicious oysters, consistently a great experience!

Whoa ! Great quality food and excellent flavors. To start, the rolls, broccoli, and Caesar salad was delicious and well developed. Our table also ordered the hen of the woods and oysters. A few of us split the Porterhouse for Three, which was excellently seasoned. To finish, the comeback special sundae was super amazing. I‚Äôm delightfully satisfied.

One issue we had was with our steak ‚Äî we ordered medium rare and it came more on the rare side. This is fine with me because I prefer my steak on the rare side, and the buttery texture and seasoning compensated. That being said, not all at my table preferred this.

All and all, I‚Äôm excited to eat here again sometime. Super modern and classy atmosphere, as well as great service. Every course was so unique from the last, and deeply satiating.

Visit it on July 6, Everything was amazing from the charcuterie board to the beef Wellington and the desserts. We also ordered a bone in ribeye to split. We weren‚Äôt exactly sure if the food was gonna be enough but our server Brandon gave us the perfect recommendation and we had just the right amount of food for everyone. The atmosphere and attention to details all the way to the marble bathroom to the brass faucets it was definitely worth a trip from Manhattan. Ask for Brandon and Sheikh Brandon knows how to provide a great experience and knows the menu very well. Sheikh won‚Äôt let a single crumb on your table or your beverage to get half empty before he is there taking care of everything.

Loved the decor of the place, the food was very good too. We got the prime rib ‚Äî it was seasoned well, and cooked to a perfect medium. I loved the fries, the boston kreme doughnut was perfection, and we enjoyed the creamed spinach too. Such a wonderful experience!

Old school esthetics. Very unique vibe to itself compared to other steakhouses I have been. Our servers were supers nice as well as the host. The manager also check in on us which is always a plus. Food overall was incredible and to the standard of a top tier steakhouse. Some of the highlights for me was their house sauce. It was rich with flavor and slight kick which is not common in most sauces. They also had a citrus dessert that was one of the best i have had in long time. The highlight of this establishment is that they have the classics but they also have unique items. Will def go back.

As soon as you walk in you‚Äôll notice the beautiful and old-school interior that gives homage for its over century old history without seeming out dated. The service was Incredible‚Äîthe hostesses and servers went above and beyond in accommodating us. While there wasn‚Äôt a stand out dish from what we ordered, we were still very pleased with the quality of food. Especially considering that we don‚Äôt normally order steaks from restaurants, but we had to try Gage and Tollner‚Äôs porterhouse given their legendary status and we weren‚Äôt disappointed. This spot is definitely worth visiting!

Top notch atmosphere that does not quite live up to the hype as one of the finest spots in the city. On my first trip I very much enjoyed the NY Strip, which was perfectly cooked and dripping with flavor.

But on my second experience I split the Ribeye for three and thought the portion size was kind of small and the meat chewy vs buttery. While the sides are solid but nothing that you can‚Äôt get elsewhere

Had a great experience taking a family member from out of town to Gage and Tolner last week. We had never been here but heard good things.

Even on a weeknight, I'd advise making a reservation, as we did have to wait a bit.

Recommended menu items:
- G&T Chilled Seafood Platter (Half Maine Lobster, Half Dozen Oysters, Clams and Shrimp Cocktail, Classic Garnishes)
- Bone-In Ribeye for Two
- Pork Pot Pie (this was insanely good)

Don't forget to hit upstairs afterward for cocktails at the sunken harbor club! Such a great experience!

Great atmosphere and beautiful dining room but unfortunately that‚Äôs where the positives tail off. I took my boyfriend here to celebrate his birthday but ultimately was left with a bad taste from this experience. Seriously overpriced for food that can be described only average at best.

Started with the Parker House Rolls which were nice and fluffy.

Followed by the seared foie gras (tiny slice - for $37?) and beef tartare which was ok but lacked seasoning.

Ribeye for 2 was the most disappointing of all. Clocking in at $163 we ordered it medium rare and it came rare on the inside and burnt to the point of being unpleasantly acrid on the palate on the outside. For this price, this should be a phenomenal, well-seasoned steak cooked perfectly, which it was not.

Since the steak comes with no side dish, the server recommended the ‚Äòhash brown‚Äô which came out as 1 slice of the trendy layered potato dish that many restaurants are doing these days. I understand the immense work that goes into making a dish like that but for nearly $20, the portion was tiny.

On top of the food, we had 1 beer and 1 soft drink and the total bill was $345 for 2 people.

The last thing to mention is the staff knew it was my boyfriend‚Äôs birthday and since we didn‚Äôt want dessert as we were already disappointed with the food (and all I could taste was burnt steak), the server did something very strange and put a candle on the metal tray when delivering the bill?! That‚Äôs a first for me. Awkwardly prompting someone to blow out a birthday candle on the bill was just a bit uncomfortable.

I really wanted to like Gage and Tollner but sad to say this, his birthday wish was probably ‚ÄòI wish we‚Äôd gone somewhere else‚Äô‚Ä¶.

Gage & Tollner was great. Was very quiet and did not seem too busy which made me wonder why when we arrived. Food was very good and atmosphere is what I am looking for when I go to a classic steakhouse. The bread and the creamed spinach were next level and the steak while not the best I have ever had was still above average. For being slow the service was average at best. Our waiter seemed like it was a bit of an inconvenience when I asked for a refill but again it was fine he did his job and brought us the food which is all I really need out of a wait staff.

The food is good and I would go back. The service we received was basic. But you can‚Äôt choose your server. We were celebrating a birthday and I asked for the dessert we ordered to come with a candle. Even though the card on our table said (Happy Birthday) my request was either forgotten or ignored. Meanwhile the table next to us also had a birthday and they got their candle celebration. We just accepted our outcome.

Wow we got lucky with this place!  We were looking for dinner one evening and stopped in and were lucky to get a table.  From the service to the food to the fun old historic restaurant this place is a win!  We had the pork pot pie, fried chicken and a side of mashed potatoes. We each ordered drinks and they were delicious!  Our server was on it. There was even someone filling our water if it got remotely low. Stop in and enjoy all this restaurant has to offer. We will be back the next time we are in Brooklyn!!

Gage & Tollner is legit. The place has this old-school, classic vibe that‚Äôs hard to come by these days‚Äîwood paneling, gas lamps, the whole deal. It feels upscale but not pretentious. The oysters were fresh, the she-crab soup was killer, and the Parker House rolls were honestly addictive. Great spot if you‚Äôre looking to impress on a date or just want a solid meal in a cool setting. Definitely worth checking out.

My husband and I went in on a whim this past Thursday night. We were greeted warmly and sat at the bar which is spacious and really comfortable. We were primarily served by Gary, who is an absolute GEM of a human being. I can't sing his praises enough. He was warm and funny and had the best recommendations for wine pairings. He really took the night to the next level. The food was delicious but our favorites were the hen of the woods mushrooms and the she crab soup. 15/10 we will be back

Four of us went to this restaurant for dinner on a Saturday night. Our reservation was early (5:30) and by the time we left, about two hours later, the place was packed.

The service and pacing were great. Our waiter took their time, answered questions, offered up some nice historic tidbits (the interior is a landmark) and stopped by regularly to make sure we had everything we wanted and were content. Which we were.

You can read many reviews about all the food and so will limit mine to two items:
The Parker House rolls: GET THEM
The Beef Wellington: GET IT (if they have it on the night you go. It was pricey but so worth it. We split it four ways and added one other entree to share. Plus two sides of the creamed spinach (every last bite was gone) and the mushrooms (ditto). We also had the she crab soup (delicious). For dessert, I had a couple of ice cream scoops since they are made in house. Very good (the mint especially) but the scoops are quite large!

It‚Äôs a splurge and enjoyable. I‚Äôd go back.

Gage & Tollner brings old-school glamour back to Brooklyn with its gorgeously restored interior‚Äîthink chandeliers, wood paneling, and white tablecloths. The oysters were impeccably fresh, and the pork chop was one of the best I've had. Service was impeccable, warm but formal. It‚Äôs the kind of place you visit for anniversaries, celebrations, or when you want to feel transported to a different time.

Got seated right away. Our server was wonderful and the entire staff was so attentive. Our water was always full and the happy hour martinis were amazing. We had a number of items that I didn‚Äôt get a chance to take a photo of, including the Crispy Hen-Of-The-Woods Mushrooms, the wedge salad, mashed potatoes and creamed spinach. Great steakhouse that offers more than steak. Thank you G&T for a great first visit.

Wonderful experience for our anniversary! Finally made it. The stakes are must try. Raw bar menu is great especially with the happy hour deal is a steal. The service is very professional and the atmosphere is def bringing back you to the old days! The staff also put our names down for the bar upstairs when we arrived (of course we asked first). Once we finished the meal, our seats upstairs opened up so perfect timing! Almost forgot to mention the unique and delicious fresh mint ice cream as dessert!

I came here for lunch for restaurant week and it definitely was a pleasure. The atmosphere is very vintage. Loved the decor.

The service was great, our server made great recommendations for questions we had. Even let us know about happy hour which was on the weekend (we came Saturday).

Loved my food and drinks. I had the restaurant week menu with a sweet potato soup, a choice of burger or turkey burger, and a peanut butter caramel ice cream. All of it was great. My friend is already saying she will def come back!

Absolutely stellar. The NY Strip steak I got here was one of the best pieces of meats I‚Äôve ever had and and served with plenty of baked garlic and a potato side reminiscent of a gratin dauphinois (I‚Äôm French yes). This is completed by the coolest and most extensive dry martini menu I‚Äôve ever seen, with variants I didn‚Äôt even know. They offer a happy hour on those and oysters. And to finish, add a historic background making you feel like you‚Äôre in a Scorsese movie or Mad Men, in this lovely area of Downtown Brooklyn. One for the books.

So happy with this evening. Everything was fantastic. We had a 5pm reservation and we got seated right away. The hosts were very welcoming. Our server for the evening was Morgan. She was phenomenal, so nice, so knowledgeable about the menu, and really made us feel welcomed. We were celebrating our anniversary so we were offered some bubbly to cheers to. The food was delicious. We ordered a lot - half a dozen of oysters, Parker rolls, a clam appetizer special with miso, chicken live pate, wedge salad, a T-bone steak with a side of mashed potatoes and onion rings, and mint ice cream and coconut sorbet for dessert.

I couldn‚Äôt stop raving on about the chicken liver pate, it was incredible. I requested extra toast because it was a very generous portion.

The tbone steak was ordered medium well, but it was more on a medium rare temperature side. We were asked how it was cooked but we aren‚Äôt ones to send food back so we said it was perfect. It was a little chewy, but the taste was very good so we were happy enough with it.

The mint ice cream was so fresh, it literally was like mint leaves, it was so nice to end the dinner off.

After dinner, we were interested in having a few drinks in the sunken harbor club, and Morgan was so nice to check on the availability with the hosts for seating, and the cocktails up there were delicious!

Went there for my birthday! This historic restaurant offers a timeless ambiance and delectable cuisine. We recently enjoyed a fantastic meal here, indulging in their classic veal for two with hashed browns, perfectly cooked fried chicken, and flavorful bass with risotto. The meal started with an appetizer of salad wedges and delectable mushrooms, and the bread was simply divine. Their wine selection is excellent, and we finished the night off with a slice of their unforgettable Alaskan cake. Overall, Gage and Tollner is a must-try for anyone seeking a memorable fine dining experience in Brooklyn. It was my 1000th restaurant in New York: where else to celebrate? It was an unforgettable experience!

Second time bringing hubby. He wanted to go again for his birthday.  Love the history of this spot and the idea of returning to an atmosphere of dressing to go out for dinner. It'd be great if they were able to expand, given their comeback, the attraction of Sunken Harbor and the neighboring construction.

As usual, we began with a dozen oysters, two blue crab soups, and tge Parker rolls. Delicious! üòã The first time I brought hubby to G&T, he had an amazing grilled blue bass. It was hard to get him to share with me. üòÜ  Unfortunately, that was not available this visit, so given the unusual price for the grilled porgy, he settled for the tilefish (cause he does not eat red meat), but truth, while handsome in presentation, it should have been a larger piece of fish. Anteways. . . . I had the NY strip, medium well with fries.  Our dinner was complimented by two old fashioned for me and a non-alcoholic spritzer for him.  Our server, Teddy, was cool. A tall dude who needs to squat down to your table to take your order, üòÜ cool dude.

We opted out of dessert but did have a nice time.

the food was delicious, but something was missing. drinks took way too long to come out, having ordered 2 drinks and them taking 20+ mins to come out, for a quiet sunday lunch isn‚Äôt ideal. we then ordered a bottle a wine but even with empty‚Ä¶
Had a great time and tried the chocolate cake, which was absolutely superb. A nice place to unwind. Shoutout to host Kylie for being accommodating and welcoming!

Super endroit o√π ils fait bon d√©guster le terre et mer, accompagn√© d'un excellent cocktail.
Ambiance r√©tro et service hors pair.
With a vintage old world like charm, this is a place worth a definite visit. Steak and seafood delicious. An old fashioned is recommended. Cheers and enjoy.

Recent visit indicated a decline in the restaurant. The Parker house rolls were actually not very tasty, and were served before the oysters, so they sat there for a while.  Dishes were good but not amazing like the first time.  The pot pie was all crust and very little substance. Seared foie gras not as good. The hen of the woods mushroom dish was very tasty though. Felt a bit overpriced, although there‚Äôs happy hour options before 6.

From a year ago:  Wow.  Wish I could give it six stars.  Lives up to the hype. Best restaurant in Brooklyn.  After an extraordinarily nice greeting from the maitre d‚Äô team we were led upstairs to the speakeasy for a drink, with its fabulous deep sea decor we felt transported - and then to the downstairs bar for an incredible dinner, amazing snails, a huge wedge salad, Korean-inspired friend chicken (with kale and kimchi slaw), incredible hash browns, and second-only-to/Daniel seared foie gras. The baked Alaska was a slight disappointment compared to the one we had at Figaro but was still excellent and the meringue just so decadent. Service was fabulous, our foie gras initially came out cold but they replaced it. Same with a bad wine bottle. The room made us feel like we were in Vienna.  Dining in Brooklyn is always more friendly than Manhattan. It‚Äôs just better.  Best restaurant in best borough.  Definitely go.

Outstanding! Gage and Tollner is definitely Brooklyn‚Äôs legacy restaurant. Not only did my friends and I have an unforgettable dining experience, we agreed that every item in the menu deserves to be savored singularly as if it‚Äôs a centerprice. Visually stunning, the plating sets a high standard, only to be further outdone by every bite you see in taste! Compliments to the chef!

I hear G & T is the favorite NYC restaurant of a certain pop superstar, but considering I find both her and this place to be bland, vanilla and forgettable, I guess that shouldn't surprise me.

Our best dish was served first: a trio of scrumptious, unique pastries all done to perfection. Kudos to Caroline Schiff for introducing the world to a Kelp and Kimchi Scone (mmm). The Rainbow Carrot Goat Cheese Danish, and Pistachio and Chocolate Snail, were no losers either. So if you're going to have your keto cheat day, this is the place to have it.

However, everything after that was a slow descent into mediocrity. Our Crispy Hen-Of-The Woods Mushrooms were great, especially with the accompanying sriracha sauce. The Dry-Aged Beef Tartare, on the other hand, was pretty tasteless. The mushrooms accompanying the Sunflower & Field Bean Risotto were great (I think these guys are just good with shrooms), but the risotto itself was undercooked and under-seasoned.

The Golden Bread Br√ªl√©e was fine but tasted like generic bread pudding for all the fancy ingredients listed with it. And our dessert splurge of Coconut Layer Cake was also fine but forgettable. They could've done so much more with the kumquat than just use it as a garnish.

Unless you reeeeally need alcohol, I'd skip the brunch cocktails that range from $18-20. Our Claret Punch just tasted like watered down sangria without any of the fruit joy.

Pretty spot, but NYC is loaded with these kinds of old-school American restaurants with rich mahogany walls and brass accents.

Celebrated our anniversary here and it was a great time. Our server was attentive and made good suggestions regarding the meals and wine pairings. The food was good and was served in a sensible order. The ambiance was intimate and cozy perfect for the occasion.

First time at Gage & Tollner - it's a very unique venue, with a vibrant (albeit noisy) atmosphere and good food. We came in for dinner on Thursday night with another couple, all of us first timers at G&T. The place was PACKED! which speaks volumes about the popularity of this fine establishment. Our meal was well-paced, at times a little bit rushed as the servers were attempting to collect plates before all of us were finished. The stand-out of the meal was the Baked Alaska - I would return here just for that!!! and believe you wouldn't find a better version of it anywhere in NYC. My entire meal, from start to finish, was a solid 4 - see photos of the dishes we tried. The menu has a nice variety of old-timey dishes to choose from. And since the descriptions are not overly detailed, you will do well engaging your server for recommendations.

Amazing food and service. This high end spot ain‚Äôt cheap but you‚Äôll be served original and prepared to perfection food. The menu is long with many options for any type of diner or mood. Fish and steaks are the stars here, but I wouldn‚Äôt mind eating only the sides and starters as they were extremely flavorful and potions sizes are huge. We were two and at the end of the meal we were bloated.
The Baked Alaska is the most beautiful dessert I have ever seen and it tastes wonderfully. It is titled as a dessert for two but it‚Äôs so big we couldn‚Äôt even finish it although we tried.
This is definitely a ‚Äúspecial occasion‚Äù type of place, mainly due to the price and the calories it entails, but what a great time it is.

Let‚Äôs just say that I‚Äôve been back here 3 times since trying it 2 weeks ago so if that‚Äôs not saying the food, service and the ambiance were the standard of dining that you should expect for this price point for entrees and drinks.
We‚Äôve had the ‚Äúperfect martini‚Äù and everything from dessert, salads and starters. Nabbing a table here has also been in our favor. Sitting at the bar for food and drinks and the other times at a table for two.
Go here and sit at the bar and ask for Patrick!

I've heard a lot of people recommend their fried chicken and had to try it. Unfortunately it was good but not worth the price or effort to visit.

The chicken is fried with some gritty mix so it comes out crunchy but the real problem was the chicken was just too dry. Considering I was served dark meat, this was a bad sign.

I also had the Caesars salad, which was good but not special. Instead of crotons they have a flat cracker that can be broken up. It looks good for the photos but doesn't taste great.

The one dish I liked was the she-crab soup. Rich, creamy and with nice chunks of crab, this is a winner.

Overall while it wasn't bad, it wasn't good enough to revisit.

Bathrooms are a little confusing because they have a sign that says to lock the door but when you go inside, it‚Äôs two separate stalls. Otherwise food and service is top tier. The she crab soup had the perfect light flavor & the Fluke Crudo has the perfect spice from the aioli & tasted so fresh! The char on the steak was perfection and the veal was definitely my favorite of the meat options. The burnt Alaska & the cheesecake desserts were the best I‚Äôve had!

Totally agree with the recommendation to get the she-crab soup - that was a surprisingly delicious appetizer. Steak is executed well and tasty, I appreciate that it comes with soft garlic to add some dimension. Personally disappointed the baked Alaska is in a portion for two so I had the doughnut instead which was pretty good!
